pr_title: feat: CORS support for Vert.x based ksqlDB

timeline.author: rodesai
rodesai

timeline.bodyText:
These defaults are coming from the Jetty defaults, right? Are they really additive like this? My interpretation of the docs was that these default values are used if the methods or headers are not explicitly supplied, but if something explicit is supplied then the defaults are ignored.
Otherwise the default of * for the allowed origins doesn't make sense.
timeline.author: vcrfxia

timeline.bodyText: Was the intention behind this to implement the Jetty default of * for allowed origins? I don't think returning early is valid because even if the allowed origins check succeeds, we should still perform the method and header checks.
timeline.author: vcrfxia

replies.bodyText: No, this means no cors handler is configured (the default).
replies.author: purplefox

replies.bodyText: Ah I see, the way rest-utils determines if CORS should be enabled or not is based on whether this config is empty or not. This behavior makes sense then.
replies.author: vcrfxia

timeline.author: vcrfxia

timeline.bodyText: Do we need to override this method? The implementation looks the same as that of the superclass.
timeline.author: vcrfxia
